scenario:
U.S. stock futures declined on Wednesday following a muted day of trading on Tuesday. Futures of major benchmark indices were lower in premarket. The Donald Trump administration levied a 245% tariff on China late Tuesday. The U.S. government also announced new export restrictions halting the shipments of Nvidia Corp.'s H20 graphics processing units to China.

The 10-year Treasury bond yielded 4.31% and the two-year bond was at 3.81%. The CME Group's FedWatch tool's projections show markets pricing a 79.9% likelihood of the Federal Reserve keeping the current interest rates unchanged in its May meeting.

Futures Change: Dow Jones -0.07%, S&P 500 -0.44%, Nasdaq 100 -1.08%, Russell 2000 -0.35%. The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) and Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ) fell in premarket on Wednesday.

Cues From Last Session: The consumer discretionary, health care, and consumer staples sectors saw the biggest declines. However, information technology and real estate stocks closed higher. Citigroup Inc. and Bank of America Corp. reported better-than-expected first-quarter earnings.

Index Performance: Nasdaq Composite -0.049%, S&P 500 -0.17%, Dow Jones -0.38%, Russell 2000 0.11%. The Dow closed 10.44% below its 52-week peak, the S&P 500 ended 12.21% off its high, and the Nasdaq 100 was 15.27% below its record.

Analysts' Insights: Mona Mahajan of Edward Jones stated that market valuations were no longer stretched, and the upside is that valuations are now looking more compelling. Jason Goepfert of White Oak Consultancy LLC noted a historical pattern where the VIX fear index dropping from above 50 to 30 has historically achieved 100% positive gains by year-end.

Upcoming Economic Data: March's U.S. retail sales, industrial production and capacity utilization data for March, business inventories for February, and the home builder confidence index for April will be announced.

Stocks In Focus: Abbott Laboratories (ABT) rose 0.74% in premarket, Travelers Companies Inc. (TRV) was up 0.076%, and Progressive Corp. (PGR) fell 0.01%.
